section.heading: Appointment of guardian ad litem.
section.text: If it appears to the Court that there is an apparent conflict between an interested person under a legal disability and a person described in section 20-101(d)(2)(A) , the Court may, in its discretion, appoint a guardian ad litem for the person with a legal disability.

annotations.annotation: D.C. Law 16-305 substituted “person with a legal disability” for “legally disabled person”.
